attributes.action: investigate an alternative method of calculating VED to ensure fairness
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A fair and logical system would set the tax rates as a linear function, discretized into bands 20gCO2/km wide. The tax due for the band is that for the *highest* value that falls within it. 

The linear portion should reflect the energy security and climate change impacts of the emissions, at a modest rate of e.g. GBP 0.50/(gCO2/km). Vehicles that emit no CO2 at all are not subject to this linear portion.

The constant coefficient should be 0.5% of the vehicle's original MSRP, reflecting the fact that those who can afford expensive cars should also make a greater contribution to society.

Example A: car with MSRP of GBP 10000, emitting 101-120gCO2/km. Annual road tax: GBP 110

Example B: car with MSRP of GBP 50000, emitting 221-240gCO2/km. Annual road tax: GBP 370

Example C: car with MSRP of GBP 100000, emitting 341-360gCO2/km. Annual road tax: GBP 680

Example: Ford Mondeo 2.0l
MSRP: GBP 18000
Emissions: 187gCO2/km
Annual road tax: GBP 190

This system also has the advantage of further penalising those who choose to buy the most polluting vehicles (current highest is over 420gCO2/km.  The highest current band is simply "greater than 255gCO2/km")
